Field Label: ## Seperation Anxiety
### Symptoms\r\n\r\nEarlier you told me that you worried about your parents or grown-ups who took care of you. I'd now like to ask you some more questions about that.
During this time, who did you have trouble being away from?
Specify (Other):
Describe:

During that time: 

 Did you feel really scared, upset or worried when you were away from (attachment figure(s))?  

 _INTERVIEWER: Code yes only if excessive; If reported before age 6, must be of panic proportions._
Did you worry that something bad might happen to your (attachment figure(s))?
What did you think might happen?
Did you ever worry that she/he might leave and not come back?
Did you worry that something bad might happen to you so you couldn't see your (attachment figure(s)) again, like getting lost or kidnapped?
When you knew that you were going to be away from home or (attachment figure(s)), did you get very upset and worry?
Did you feel so nervous or afraid to go to school that you wouldn't go or you had to be forced to go?
Was this because you wanted to stay with your (attachment figure(s))?
Was this only during the first few days of school?
Did your (attachment figure(s)) ever stay with you in school?
Were there any other places you would not go because you are afraid to be away from (attachment figure)?
Did you need your (attachment figure(s)) to stay with you while you fell asleep?
Was it hard for you to sleep away from home without (attachment figure(s))?

When you were at home with your (attachment figure(s)), were you scared of being alone in your room or any place in the house? For example, if you were in your room and your parents (attachment figure) were in the kitchen, did you go to the kitchen to be with your (attachment figure)?
Did you have a lot of bad dreams about getting hurt or about something bad happening so you couldn't see your (attachment figure(s))?
Did you get sick to your stomach, have headaches, or throw-up when your (attachment figure) had to go out without you?
_INTERVIEWER: The participant did not endorse any fear/worries. End **Separation Anxiety** Section._
